definitions.example: The best way to cook artichokes is to steam them.

definitions.definition: To expose to the action of steam; to apply steam to for softening, dressing, or preparing.
To rise in vapour; to issue, or pass off, as vapour.
definitions.example: Our breath steamed in the cold winter air.

definitions.definition: To become angry; to fume; to be incensed.

definitions.example: It really steams me to see her treat him like that.

definitions.definition: To be covered with condensed water vapor.
definitions.example: With all the heavy breathing going on the windows were quickly steamed in the car.

definitions.definition: To travel by means of steam power.
definitions.example: The ship steamed out of the harbour

definitions.definition: To move with great or excessive purposefulness.
definitions.example: If he heard of anyone picking the fruit he would steam off and lecture them.
He was steamed that the car cut him off. It took almost half an hour for him to calm down.
